description: The 2025 NFL season has commenced with Week 1 games, featuring key team matchups, player injuries and trades, and international games, marking the start of what fans expect to be a competitive season.
why_is_it_trending: The official start of the NFL 2025 season began on September 4-5, marking a major event for American football fans nationwide and globally.
Notable news includes the trade of star edge rusher Micah Parsons from the Dallas Cowboys to the Green Bay Packers and key players returning from injuries affecting team dynamics.
The NFL's effort to grow its international presence is highlighted by an NFL International Game held in São Paulo, Brazil, featuring the Kansas City Chiefs and Los Angeles Rams.
key_points: Significant games include the Detroit Lions pursuing a third straight NFC North title against the Green Bay Packers, Commanders hosting the Giants, and other key division contests.
The Miami Dolphins are managing multiple injuries but expect the return of important players like De’Von Achane, Tyreek Hill, and Darren Waller, crucial for their Week 1 performance.
The Dallas Cowboys are adjusting post-Micah Parsons trade with offensive improvements expected if quarterback Dak Prescott maintains health and new wide receiver George Pickens performs well.
overlook_what_might_happen_next: Expect a season of strategic plays, injury management, and breakout performances that will shape playoff contenders and candidates for the Super Bowl.
The NFL is likely to schedule more international games to capitalize on expanding fan bases outside the U.S., enhancing the league's global footprint.
Teams like the Dallas Cowboys and Miami Dolphins will need to quickly adapt to roster changes and injuries to remain competitive through the season.
